H0.text: Emigration is the ecosystem factor whose increase could cause a population decline in a bird species.

H1.text: Immigration is an ecosystem factor whose increase could cause a population decline in a bird species.

H2.text: An increase in the number of births could cause a population decline in a bird species.

H3.text: The amount of food is an ecosystem factor whose increase could cause a population decline in a bird species.

A4.text: metapopulation ecology assumes that species in a habitat will emigrate out before it becomes uninhabitable

A5.text: Exponential population growth of Monk Parakeets is likely due to reproduction within their population
